rt

Class HitRecord

  • java.lang.Object
    • rt.HitRecord

  • public class HitRecord
extends java.lang.Object
    Stores information about a ray-surface intersection. This information is typically used for shading.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      Intersectable intersectable
      The Intersectable that was hit.
      Material material
      The material at the hit point.
      javax.vecmath.Vector3f normal
      Normal at hit point.
      float p
      Area probability density.
      javax.vecmath.Vector3f position
      Hit position.
      float t
      t parameter of the ray at the hit point.
      javax.vecmath.Vector3f t1
      Tangent vectors at hit point.
      javax.vecmath.Vector3f t2
      Tangent vectors at hit point.
      float u
      Texture coordinates at hit point.
      float v
      Texture coordinates at hit point.
      javax.vecmath.Vector3f w
      Direction towards origin of ray that hit surface.

    • Field Detail

      • position

        public javax.vecmath.Vector3f position
        Hit position.

      • normal

        public javax.vecmath.Vector3f normal
        Normal at hit point.

      • t1

        public javax.vecmath.Vector3f t1
        Tangent vectors at hit point.

      • t2

        public javax.vecmath.Vector3f t2
        Tangent vectors at hit point.

      • u

        public float u
        Texture coordinates at hit point.

      • v

        public float v
        Texture coordinates at hit point.

      • w

        public javax.vecmath.Vector3f w
        Direction towards origin of ray that hit surface. By convention it points away from the surface, that is, in the direction opposite to the incident ray.

      • t

        public float t
        t parameter of the ray at the hit point.

      • intersectable

        public Intersectable intersectable
        The Intersectable that was hit.

      • material

        public Material material
        The material at the hit point.

      • p

        public float p
        Area probability density. This is typically used when a hit record is generated by sampling the geometry, like in implementations of LightGeometry.
